text.p: -- EVEREN Securities said Wednesday it raised its earnings estimates for Sherwin-Williams Co, which makes paints and wall coverings, to $1.01 a share from $0.99 for the third quarter and to $2.66 from $2.64 for 1996.
-- The 1997 estimate was raised to $3.05 from $2.95.
-- "The (third quarter) increase reflects strong sales trends during seasonally important months in July and August owing to dry weather conditions conducive to painting activity," EVEREN said.
-- The 1997 increase reflects expected integration of recent acquisitions.
-- Target prices are being increased to $50 a share from $45 for six months and to $53 from $48 for 18 months.
-- Shares are rated market perform in the intermediate term and outperform for the longer term.
